Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2011 01:11PM hondagirl wrote: I have had the same issue as well.  It has been almost a week since this fluid has been sitting there.  They said it is not enough to aspirate but it doesn't seem like it is reabsorbing either.  The NP said that sometimes when the tissue expander is expanded a bit it can seal off the place where the fluid is coming from so there is no more fluid that is added.  I think that helped but there is still residual fluid there which remains.  I have already been in the hospital for one post surgery infection and  I don't want another one.  But their arguement is that introducing a needle into the site to aspirate can cause infection too.  Ugh!  Please absorb soon!
Posts.Title: Seroma after surgery scruz hondagirl
